intro: Chrysophyllum decandrum, commonly known as the Natal plum or yellow star. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa, characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Chrysophyllum decandrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
